archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Grilled Picanha with Garlic Spanish Rice and Charred Peppers
description: Showstopper family feast of juicy grilled picanha over garlicky Spanish rice with smoky charred peppers and lemon-parsley finish.
prep_steps: Pat dry the picanha steak and score the fat cap in a crosshatch (shallow cuts).
Season the picanha all over with salt, black pepper, and a light dusting of paprika.
Rinse the spanish rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain well.
Slice bell peppers into thick strips; peel and slice onions; peel and finely chop garlic.
Roughly chop parsley; cut the lemon into wedges (reserve a little zest if desired).
Preheat Outdoor Grill to medium-high. Set oven to 220°C/425°F (for finishing peppers if needed).
Set a wide stovetop pot or deep skillet for rice over medium heat.
cook_steps: Start peppers: Toss bell peppers and onions with olive oil, salt, and a pinch of paprika. Place on the grill in a grill basket or on a tray; cook until lightly charred and tender (10–15 minutes), turning occasionally. If needed, transfer to the oven to finish softening.

Render and sear picanha: Place picanha fat-side down on the grill over indirect-to-medium heat to render the fat (6–8 minutes), moving to avoid flare-ups. Flip and grill to desired doneness (approx. 8–12 minutes more for medium-rare), then rest on a board 10 minutes.
Start rice base: Add olive oil to the hot pot. Sauté onions with a pinch of salt until translucent (5 minutes). Stir in garlic and a pinch of paprika for 30 seconds.

Toast and simmer rice: Add drained spanish rice; stir 1–2 minutes to coat. Pour in white wine and simmer until mostly absorbed. Add chicken stock and bay leaves, bring to a gentle boil, then reduce to low, cover, and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed (15–18 minutes).
Finish sides: Toss charred peppers and onions with a squeeze of lemon and half the chopped parsley. Keep warm.
Finish rice: Remove bay leaves; rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff. Stir in remaining parsley and a small squeeze of lemon (optional zest to taste).
Slice and serve: Slice picanha against the grain. Serve over the garlic Spanish rice with the charred peppers alongside. Finish with a light drizzle of olive oil and lemon wedges.
